RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator

RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator Class Reference

#include <velocitycalculator.h>

Inheritance diagram for RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Superlass for computation of moving velocity.

The velocity you get by a call to getNextFrame() is the value for the move of the rendering frame, not for the overall timeline.

This class use a Ogre Timer for its platform independant facility. You can use in its subclasses either getMilliseconds() or getMicroseconds() to get the time elapsed since the call to start().

If the transitionTime is passed, mRunning must be set to false;

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::VelocityCalculator (  ) 

The default constructor.

It creates a new Ogre timer and set the transitionTime equal to the GuiManager default transition time.

Definition at line 34 of file velocitycalculator.cpp.

RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::~VelocityCalculator (  )  [virtual]

The default destructor.

It asks the Ogre platform manager to destroy the used Ogre timer.

Member Function Documentation

virtual float RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::getNextFrame ( bool &   )  [pure virtual]

Get the next velocity.

The bool parameter must be set to false if the transition ended.

Implemented in RainbruRPG::Core::vcConstant.

void RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::setTranslationLenght ( float  f  ) 

Sets the total lenght of translation.

OpenGL uses often a translation factor in screen size (1.0 is the half screen).

It sends a warning log if the given parameter is equal to 0.

Parameters:
f The new translation lenght

Definition at line 92 of file velocitycalculator.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::setTransitionTime ( unsigned int  i  ) 

Sets the transition time.

See the subclass documentation you are using to know if it uses milliseconds or microseconds as the Ogre timer handles both times.

It sends a warning log if the given parameter is equal to 0.

Parameters:
i The new transition time

void RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::reset (  ) 

Reset this instance.

bool RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::running (  ) 

Is this velocity calculator running ?

It simply returns the value of VelocityCalculator::mRunning

true if this instance is running, otherwise false

Member Data Documentation

unsigned long RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::lastFrameTimeLine [protected]

The time get from the Ogre timer for the last frame.

It can be in milliseconds or microseconds according to what you use. Its default value is 0.
